description:
Speaker: Jan-Benedikt Jagusch

Track:PyData
In this talk you will learn how to visualize graph networks in Python, using `networkx`, `traitlets`, `ipywidgets` and `plotly`. The resulting plot will be fully interactive, which makes it easy to filter edges, find nodes by their name and update the graph's layout.

Recorded at the PyConDE & PyData Berlin 2019 conference.
https://pycon.de

More details at the conference page: https://de.pycon.org/program/HFKNUW
Twitter:  https://twitter.com/pydataberlin
Twitter:  https://twitter.com/pyconde
title: Visualizing Interactive Graph Networks in Python
